channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Dist-PU: Positive-Unlabeled Learning from a Label Distribution Perspective
item.description: Positive-Unlabeled (PU) learning tries to learn binary classifiers from a few labeled positive examples with many unlabeled ones.

item.title: Super-resolution Probabilistic Rain Prediction from Satellite Data Using 3D U-Nets and EarthFormers
item.description: To further improve the model performance, multi-model ensemble and threshold optimization were used to produce the final probabilistic rain prediction.

item.title: FacT: Factor-Tuning for Lightweight Adaptation on Vision Transformer
item.description: Recent work has explored the potential to adapt a pre-trained vision transformer (ViT) by updating only a few parameters so as to improve storage efficiency, called parameter-efficient transfer learning (PETL).

item.title: Robust Point Cloud Segmentation with Noisy Annotations
item.description: To handle boundary-level label noise, we also propose a variant ``PNAL-boundary " with a progressive boundary label cleaning strategy.

item.title: UniGeo: Unifying Geometry Logical Reasoning via Reformulating Mathematical Expression
item.description: Naturally, we also present a unified multi-task Geometric Transformer framework, Geoformer, to tackle calculation and proving problems simultaneously in the form of sequence generation, which finally shows the reasoning ability can be improved on both two tasks by unifying formulation.

item.title: Tackling Data Heterogeneity in Federated Learning with Class Prototypes
item.description: We propose FedNH, a novel method that improves the local models' performance for both personalization and generalization by combining the uniformity and semantics of class prototypes.

item.title: InternVideo: General Video Foundation Models via Generative and Discriminative Learning
item.description: Specifically, InternVideo efficiently explores masked video modeling and video-language contrastive learning as the pretraining objectives, and selectively coordinates video representations of these two complementary frameworks in a learnable manner to boost various video applications.

item.title: Towards human-compatible autonomous car: A study of non-verbal Turing test in automated driving with affective transition modelling
item.description: Participants rode in autonomous cars (driven by either human or AI drivers) as a passenger and judged whether the driver was human or AI.

item.title: Iterative Next Boundary Detection for Instance Segmentation of Tree Rings in Microscopy Images of Shrub Cross Sections
item.description: We analyze the problem of detecting tree rings in microscopy images of shrub cross sections.

item.title: DiffusionInst: Diffusion Model for Instance Segmentation
item.description: This paper proposes DiffusionInst, a novel framework that represents instances as instance-aware filters and formulates instance segmentation as a noise-to-filter denoising process.

item.title: Simple Baseline for Weather Forecasting Using Spatiotemporal Context Aggregation Network
item.description: Traditional weather forecasting relies on domain expertise and computationally intensive numerical simulation systems.

item.title: Adaptive Testing of Computer Vision Models
item.description: Vision models often fail systematically on groups of data that share common semantic characteristics (e. g., rare objects or unusual scenes), but identifying these failure modes is a challenge.

item.title: Document-Level Abstractive Summarization
item.description: The task of automatic text summarization produces a concise and fluent text summary while preserving key information and overall meaning.

item.title: Loss Adapted Plasticity in Deep Neural Networks to Learn from Data with Unreliable Sources
item.description: When data is streaming from multiple sources, conventional training methods update model weights often assuming the same level of reliability for each source; that is: a model does not consider data quality of each source during training.

item.title: SSDA3D: Semi-supervised Domain Adaptation for 3D Object Detection from Point Cloud
item.description: However, these UDA solutions just yield unsatisfactory 3D detection results when there is a severe domain shift, e. g., from Waymo (64-beam) to nuScenes (32-beam).

item.title: Towards a more efficient computation of individual attribute and policy contribution for post-hoc explanation of cooperative multi-agent systems using Myerson values
item.description: A quantitative assessment of the global importance of an agent in a team is as valuable as gold for strategists, decision-makers, and sports coaches.

item.title: Neural Machine Translation with Contrastive Translation Memories
item.description: Retrieval-augmented Neural Machine Translation models have been successful in many translation scenarios.

item.title: Robust convex biclustering with a tuning-free method
item.description: Therefore, we propose a tuning-free method for automatically selecting the optimal robustification parameter with high efficiency.

item.title: ACRO: A multi-language toolkit for supporting Automated Checking of Research Outputs
item.description: This paper discusses the development of an open source tool ACRO, (Automatic Checking of Research Outputs) to assist researchers and data governance teams by distinguishing between: research output that is safe to publish; output that requires further analysis; and output that cannot be published because it creates substantial risk of disclosing private data.

item.title: Union-set Multi-source Model Adaptation for Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Model adaptation is proposed as a new domain adaptation problem which requires access to a pre-trained model instead of data for the source domain.

item.title: Semantic-Conditional Diffusion Networks for Image Captioning
item.description: The rich semantics are further regarded as semantic prior to trigger the learning of Diffusion Transformer, which produces the output sentence in a diffusion process.

item.title: Knowledge-Bridged Causal Interaction Network for Causal Emotion Entailment
item.description: Moreover, social-interaction CSK serves as emotion-level bridge (E-bridge) and action-level bridge (A-bridge) to connect candidate utterances with the target one, which provides explicit causal clues for the Emotional Interaction module and Actional Interaction module to reason the target emotion.

item.title: Semantic-aware Message Broadcasting for Efficient Unsupervised Domain Adaptation
item.description: In this way, our message broadcasting encourages the group tokens to learn more informative and diverse information for effective domain alignment.

item.title: QEBVerif: Quantization Error Bound Verification of Neural Networks
item.description: While promising attempts have been made to verify the quantization error bound between DNNs and their quantized counterparts, they are not complete and more importantly do not support fully quantified neural networks, namely, only weights are quantized.

item.title: GD-MAE: Generative Decoder for MAE Pre-training on LiDAR Point Clouds
item.description: In contrast to previous 3D MAE frameworks, which either design a complex decoder to infer masked information from maintained regions or adopt sophisticated masking strategies, we instead propose a much simpler paradigm.

item.title: IncepFormer: Efficient Inception Transformer with Pyramid Pooling for Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Semantic segmentation usually benefits from global contexts, fine localisation information, multi-scale features, etc.

item.title: Proximal methods for point source localisation
item.description: Point source localisation is generally modelled as a Lasso-type problem on measures.

item.title: PØDA: Prompt-driven Zero-shot Domain Adaptation
item.description: Domain adaptation has been vastly investigated in computer vision but still requires access to target images at train time, which might be intractable in some conditions, especially for long-tail samples.

item.title: PointCaM: Cut-and-Mix for Open-Set Point Cloud Analysis
item.description: Specifically, we use the Unknown-Point Simulator to simulate unknown data in the training stage by manipulating the geometric context of partial known data.

item.title: Images Speak in Images: A Generalist Painter for In-Context Visual Learning
item.description: In this work, we present Painter, a generalist model which addresses these obstacles with an "image"-centric solution, that is, to redefine the output of core vision tasks as images, and specify task prompts as also images.

item.title: Exploring Stroke-Level Modifications for Scene Text Editing
item.description: Moreover, two new datasets (Tamper-Syn2k and Tamper-Scene) are proposed to fill the blank of public evaluation datasets.

item.title: Window Normalization: Enhancing Point Cloud Understanding by Unifying Inconsistent Point Densities
item.description: Existing methods are limited by the inconsistent point densities of different parts in the point cloud.

item.title: AIDA: Analytic Isolation and Distance-based Anomaly Detection Algorithm
item.description: We combine the metrics of distance and isolation to develop the \textit{Analytic Isolation and Distance-based Anomaly (AIDA) detection algorithm}.

item.title: A Dataless FaceSwap Detection Approach Using Synthetic Images
item.description: Face swapping technology used to create "Deepfakes" has advanced significantly over the past few years and now enables us to create realistic facial manipulations.

item.title: Query Your Model with Definitions in FrameNet: An Effective Method for Frame Semantic Role Labeling
item.description: Such methods usually model role classification as naive multi-class classification and treat arguments individually, which neglects label semantics and interactions between arguments and thus hindering performance and generalization of models.

item.title: A Machine with Short-Term, Episodic, and Semantic Memory Systems
item.description: Inspired by the cognitive science theory of the explicit human memory systems, we have modeled an agent with short-term, episodic, and semantic memory systems, each of which is modeled with a knowledge graph.

item.title: TD3 with Reverse KL Regularizer for Offline Reinforcement Learning from Mixed Datasets
item.description: There are two challenges for this setting: 1) The optimal trade-off between optimizing the RL signal and the behavior cloning (BC) signal changes on different states due to the variation of the action coverage induced by different behavior policies.

item.title: Observational and Interventional Causal Learning for Regret-Minimizing Control
item.description: A state-of-the-art observational causal discovery algorithm for time series capable of handling latent confounders and contemporaneous effects, called LPCMCI, is extended to profit from casual constraints found through randomized control trials.

item.title: Hierarchical Contrast for Unsupervised Skeleton-based Action Representation Learning
item.description: This paper targets unsupervised skeleton-based action representation learning and proposes a new Hierarchical Contrast (HiCo) framework.

item.title: Momentum Decoding: Open-ended Text Generation As Graph Exploration
item.description: In this study, we formulate open-ended text generation from a new perspective, i. e., we view it as an exploration process within a directed graph.

item.title: Solving the Weather4cast Challenge via Visual Transformers for 3D Images
item.description: Accurately forecasting the weather is an important task, as many real-world processes and decisions depend on future meteorological conditions.

item.title: Certifying Fairness of Probabilistic Circuits
item.description: In this paper, we propose an algorithm to search for discrimination patterns in a general class of probabilistic models, namely probabilistic circuits.

item.title: MapInWild: A Remote Sensing Dataset to Address the Question What Makes Nature Wild
item.description: Antrophonegic pressure (i. e. human influence) on the environment is one of the largest causes of the loss of biological diversity.

item.title: Impact of Domain-Adapted Multilingual Neural Machine Translation in the Medical Domain
item.description: Multilingual Neural Machine Translation (MNMT) models leverage many language pairs during training to improve translation quality for low-resource languages by transferring knowledge from high-resource languages.

item.title: Deep Learning Architectures for FSCV, a Comparison
item.description: We examined multiple deep neural network (DNN) architectures for suitability in predicting neurotransmitter concentrations from labeled in vitro fast scan cyclic voltammetry (FSCV) data collected on carbon fiber electrodes.

item.title: Med-Query: Steerable Parsing of 9-DoF Medical Anatomies with Query Embedding
item.description: For rib parsing, CT scans have been annotated at the rib instance-level for quantitative evaluation, similarly for spine vertebrae and abdominal organs.

item.title: Graph Convolutional Neural Networks with Diverse Negative Samples via Decomposed Determinant Point Processes
item.description: However, there are more non-neighbour nodes in the whole graph, which provide diverse and useful information for the representation update.

item.title: This changes to that : Combining causal and non-causal explanations to generate disease progression in capsule endoscopy
item.description: Due to the unequivocal need for understanding the decision processes of deep learning networks, both modal-dependent and model-agnostic techniques have become very popular.

item.title: SASFormer: Transformers for Sparsely Annotated Semantic Segmentation
item.description: In this work, we propose a simple yet effective sparse annotated semantic segmentation framework based on segformer, dubbed SASFormer, that achieves remarkable performance.

item.title: Federated Neural Topic Models
item.description: Over the last years, topic modeling has emerged as a powerful technique for organizing and summarizing big collections of documents or searching for particular patterns in them.
